extension.name: org.apache.nifi.amqp.processors.ConsumeAMQP
extension.description: Consumes AMQP Messages from an AMQP Broker using the AMQP 0.9.1 protocol. Each message that is received from the AMQP Broker will be emitted as its own FlowFile to the 'success' relationship.

property.name: Queue
property.description: The name of the existing AMQP Queue from which messages will be consumed. Usually pre-defined by AMQP administrator.

property.name: auto.acknowledge
property.description: If false (Non-Auto-Acknowledge), the messages will be acknowledged by the processor after transferring the FlowFiles to success and committing the NiFi session. Non-Auto-Acknowledge mode provides 'at-least-once' delivery semantics. If true (Auto-Acknowledge), messages that are delivered to the AMQP Client will be auto-acknowledged by the AMQP Broker just after sending them out. This generally will provide better throughput but will also result in messages being lost upon restart/crash of the AMQP Broker, NiFi or the processor. Auto-Acknowledge mode provides 'at-most-once' delivery semantics and it is recommended only if loosing messages is acceptable.

property.name: batch.size
property.description: The maximum number of messages that should be processed in a single session. Once this many messages have been received (or once no more messages are readily available), the messages received will be transferred to the 'success' relationship and the messages will be acknowledged to the AMQP Broker. Setting this value to a larger number could result in better performance, particularly for very small messages, but can also result in more messages being duplicated upon sudden restart of NiFi.

property.name: remove.curly.braces
property.description: If true Remove Curly Braces, Curly Braces in the header will be automatically remove.

property.name: header.separator
property.description: The character that is used to separate key-value for header in String. The value must only one character.Otherwise you will get an error message

property.name: Brokers
property.description: A comma-separated list of known AMQP Brokers in the format <host>:<port> (e.g., localhost:5672). If this is set, Host Name and Port are ignored. Only include hosts from the same AMQP cluster.

property.name: Host Name
property.description: Network address of AMQP broker (e.g., localhost). If Brokers is set, then this property is ignored.

property.name: Port
property.description: Numeric value identifying Port of AMQP broker (e.g., 5671). If Brokers is set, then this property is ignored.

property.name: Virtual Host
property.description: Virtual Host name which segregates AMQP system for enhanced security.

property.name: User Name
property.description: User Name used for authentication and authorization.

property.name: Password
property.description: Password used for authentication and authorization.

property.name: AMQP Version
property.description: AMQP Version. Currently only supports AMQP v0.9.1.

property.name: ssl-context-service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections.

property.name: cert-authentication
property.description: Authenticate using the SSL certificate rather than user name/password.

property.name: ssl-client-auth
property.description: The property has no effect and therefore deprecated.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are received from the AMQP queue are routed to this relationship

writesAttribute.name: amqp$appId
writesAttribute.description: The App ID field from the AMQP Message

writesAttribute.name: amqp$contentEncoding
writesAttribute.description: The Content Encoding reported by the AMQP Message

writesAttribute.name: amqp$contentType
writesAttribute.description: The Content Type reported by the AMQP Message

writesAttribute.name: amqp$headers
writesAttribute.description: The headers present on the AMQP Message

writesAttribute.name: amqp$deliveryMode
writesAttribute.description: The numeric indicator for the Message's Delivery Mode

writesAttribute.name: amqp$replyTo
writesAttribute.description: The value of the Message's Reply-To field

writesAttribute.name: amqp$messageId
writesAttribute.description: The unique ID of the Message

writesAttribute.name: amqp$timestamp
writesAttribute.description: The timestamp of the Message, as the number of milliseconds since epoch

writesAttribute.name: amqp$clusterId
writesAttribute.description: The ID of the AMQP Cluster

writesAttribute.name: amqp$routingKey
writesAttribute.description: The routingKey of the AMQP Message

writesAttribute.name: amqp$exchange
writesAttribute.description: The exchange from which AMQP Message was received

extension.name: org.apache.nifi.amqp.processors.PublishAMQP
extension.description: Creates an AMQP Message from the contents of a FlowFile and sends the message to an AMQP Exchange. In a typical AMQP exchange model, the message that is sent to the AMQP Exchange will be routed based on the 'Routing Key' to its final destination in the queue (the binding). If due to some misconfiguration the binding between the Exchange, Routing Key and Queue is not set up, the message will have no final destination and will return (i.e., the data will not make it to the queue). If that happens you will see a log in both app-log and bulletin stating to that effect, and the FlowFile will be routed to the 'failure' relationship.

property.name: Exchange Name
property.description: The name of the AMQP Exchange the messages will be sent to. Usually provided by the AMQP administrator (e.g., 'amq.direct'). It is an optional property. If kept empty the messages will be sent to a default AMQP exchange.

property.name: Routing Key
property.description: The name of the Routing Key that will be used by AMQP to route messages from the exchange to a destination queue(s). Usually provided by the administrator (e.g., 'myKey')In the event when messages are sent to a default exchange this property corresponds to a destination queue name, otherwise a binding from the Exchange to a Queue via Routing Key must be set (usually by the AMQP administrator)

property.name: header.separator
property.description: The character that is used to split key-value for headers. The value must only one character. Otherwise you will get an error message

property.name: Brokers
property.description: A comma-separated list of known AMQP Brokers in the format <host>:<port> (e.g., localhost:5672). If this is set, Host Name and Port are ignored. Only include hosts from the same AMQP cluster.

property.name: Host Name
property.description: Network address of AMQP broker (e.g., localhost). If Brokers is set, then this property is ignored.

property.name: Port
property.description: Numeric value identifying Port of AMQP broker (e.g., 5671). If Brokers is set, then this property is ignored.

property.name: Virtual Host
property.description: Virtual Host name which segregates AMQP system for enhanced security.

property.name: User Name
property.description: User Name used for authentication and authorization.

property.name: Password
property.description: Password used for authentication and authorization.

property.name: AMQP Version
property.description: AMQP Version. Currently only supports AMQP v0.9.1.

property.name: ssl-context-service
property.description: The SSL Context Service used to provide client certificate information for TLS/SSL connections.

property.name: cert-authentication
property.description: Authenticate using the SSL certificate rather than user name/password.

property.name: ssl-client-auth
property.description: The property has no effect and therefore deprecated.

relationship.name: success
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that are sent to the AMQP destination are routed to this relationship

relationship.name: failure
relationship.description: All FlowFiles that cannot be routed to the AMQP destination are routed to this relationship

readsAttribute.name: amqp$appId
readsAttribute.description: The App ID field to set on the AMQP Message

readsAttribute.name: amqp$contentEncoding
readsAttribute.description: The Content Encoding to set on the AMQP Message

readsAttribute.name: amqp$contentType
readsAttribute.description: The Content Type to set on the AMQP Message

readsAttribute.name: amqp$headers
readsAttribute.description: The headers to set on the AMQP Message

readsAttribute.name: amqp$deliveryMode
readsAttribute.description: The numeric indicator for the Message's Delivery Mode

readsAttribute.name: amqp$replyTo
readsAttribute.description: The value of the Message's Reply-To field

readsAttribute.name: amqp$messageId
readsAttribute.description: The unique ID of the Message

readsAttribute.name: amqp$timestamp
readsAttribute.description: The timestamp of the Message, as the number of milliseconds since epoch

readsAttribute.name: amqp$clusterId
readsAttribute.description: The ID of the AMQP Cluster

systemResourceConsideration.description: An instance of this component can cause high usage of this system resource. Multiple instances or high concurrency settings may result a degradation of performance.
